subNodes.conversationText: root
"Stop, <FullName>! Trap, trap!" Rani flutters around your head. She is right - a wire has been drawn across the path in front of you, tied taught between the trees at ankle height.
Examine the trap.

You bend over and run your finger over the tripwire gingerly. It is connected to a rope trap, which would have left you hanging helplessly upside down had you triggered it. Suddenly, there is a burst of laughter from the woods. "Watch you don't trigger it by accident! You look as clumsy as an Umgak."
"Who is there?"

A figure emerges from the dark forest. It is hooded, its face is masked with cloth, and its figure hidden in tough looking leather armour, but by its gait and voice you can tell it is female. You notice the sharp, curved blade hanging from her back.
Continue.
She notices your look. "If I meant you harm, I would not have stepped out of the wood in front of you."
"Who are you?"
"I do not usually give my name so freely, but these are special circumstances. I am Anu. And you are...?"
"I am <FullName>."
"Well met." Anu moves lithely around the tripwire and bows slightly in front of you. "You seem an honourable one, and that's for sure. A rare find in this dark place."
"What are you doing here, laying traps on the path?"

She laughs. "A fair question. In truth, I seem to be trapped. There was a path here that led out of the forest. I know this, because I came in through this path only a day ago. But the forest has taken it back."
"What do you mean, taken it back?"
"Look! There is no way through. The trees and bushes swamp the way. And their branches are sharp - I swear that they stab you deliberately. There is no way out of the forest."
"There must be a way out!"

Anu laughs again. Despite the warmth in her voice and engaging laugh, you notice that her eyes are cold and sharp. "This might be quite fortuitous for us both. You are trying to escape, yes? And you look like you can handle yourself. Perhaps we can help each other out. I suspect our problems are... linked."
"Go on."

"I am a bounty hunter. I came to the forest on the trail of a man, a druid, who had committed certain.... atrocities in the city of Blackwinter. I have been tracking him for weeks. I thought I had lost him, but then I picked up his trail again at the Black Moon tavern just off the King's Road, and that brought me here."
Continue.
"Kaven came to this forest for a reason. I suspect he is tied up in whatever mess is going on here. The walking dead? Those squirrel things? It has his fingerprints all over it."
Continue.

"I suspect the only way to open the paths out of the forest is to track him down and kill him. I have been thwarted in any attempt to gather reenforcements, so I guess you are it. Help me kill Kaven, and I will help you get out of the forest."
"You are welcome to join me, Anu. I'm not going to kill anyone on your word alone, though."
Anu's eyes narrow. "We will see. Let us go."
Continue.
"I am not travelling with an assassin. You're on your own."
Anu's eyes narrow. "Very well. Be careful with the traps in the forest. Some of them can be deadly." She quickly disappears back into the dark forest.
Continue.
